main.name: Jeans Patel
main.description: I am a forth year Computer Science student at the University of Guelph
main.bio: I'm working towards my Bachlors in Computing with a Mathamatics minor at the University of Guelph. I enjoy learning new languages and applying the skills I learned at university in the real world. I love working in teams and meeting new people. My hobbies include online gaming, table tennis, computers and I've recently gotten intrested in VR technology.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: These are some skills I've learned throughout my projects and work experience.

education.description: Culminative GPA: 85%. I'm working towards a Mathematics minor along with my bachlors in computing. I've been on the honor roll every year and I'm a part of the University League of Legends team.

project.name: Image Processing
project.subject: Image Processing and Vision
project.description: I worked with a partner to implement and compare image processing algorithms using reserch articles. I used Python to implement, test, and compare various image processing algorithms. After performing the tests, I presented the algorithms, methods of testing, and results in an organized report. This project improved my analyzing and presentation skills and I learned more about Python.

project.name: Inventum - Media Browsing App
project.subject: Software Engineering
project.description: I worked in a group of 4 other classmates to add functionality to an existing open-source Andriod application using Java. We following the agile-scrum methodology to develop the application and we used GitHub to manage the project. Sprints were 2 weeks long and after each sprint we presented out progress to the class. After the final sprint we presented our final product to the professor and class through a formal presentation. This project improved my collaboration, organization and presentation skills, this was also my first time working with Andriod development.

project.name: SVG Parser
project.subject: Software System Development and Integration
project.description: This was an independant project for my Software System Development and Integration course. I built and used a C library to parse SVG images. I used JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to create a webpage to display information about the parsed SVG images. All the data about the SVG images were stored in a MySQL database. This was my first time working with webpages and librarys so I learned how the front-end and back-end work together to display information. I also learned how to use JQuery and AJAX to create webpages.

project.name: Rouge-like 3D Game
project.subject: Game Programming
project.description: This was an independant project for my Game Programming course. I created a 3D rouge-like gaming using a game engine in C. First, I generated random maze-like rooms, corridors, and levels. These rooms were randomized every time the game was restarted so you'd always enter a new layout. Then, I added enemies, obstacles so the player has elements to interact with. Finally, I added 'fog-of-war' to optimize and refine the game. I have a passion for gaming and this project taught me the fundamentals of game design.
